data.title: Update Quick Fix Lightbulb once a Fix has been Applied
data.body:
Fixes #21060

**Bug**
The quick fix lightbulb widget does not get updated after a quick fix is applied. This seems to happen when the quick fix does not touch the span containing the lightbulb widget itself.

**Fix**
The root cause seems to be that the quick fix model does not broadcast an update event when a quick fix is applied. To workaround this, force an update when the markers are updated even if the range for the current cursor remains the same.

data.title: Bad sorting in quick open
data.body:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/23205362/e5552552-f8e9-11e6-8363-3792fed26a02.png)

We should also take in consideration _consecutive_ characters, not just whether their position is early in the string.

I.e. consecutive characters always should sort before: 1 match (`icon`) should always be before two matches (`i` and `con`).

data.title: Theme service stops listening to settings change?
data.body:
Testing #20998

1. Pick theme A
2. Create a syntax error in settings.json
3. Change to theme B. Get an error message saying to fix the syntax error. The theme is still applied.
4. Fix syntax error, effectively trying to set theme A again

Theme A isn't set back. Further settings change don't trigger the change back to theme A.

data.title: Better column indicator icon
data.body:
Currently we use the same yellow arrow for showing the current line indicator in the glyph margin and inline in the editor to indicate column. As shown in the following gif

![column](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/23204039/4001d784-f8e5-11e6-868c-b170dd40ccc4.gif)

After discussing with @weinand we believe a more appropraite icon could be used as a replacement for the current [yellow arrow](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/debug/browser/media/current-arrow.svg#L1) 
We believe a more fitting one would be a thin but high yellow styliezd triangle pointing to the right. This way it would not take so much space in the editor and would still provide the desired functionality. So basically to make the current icon thinner and higher and maybe cut out the left end.

@chryw is it possible for you to give us a hand with this? If not then @chrisdias what is our process when there is no appropriate icon in https://vsicons.azurewebsites.net/

data.title: Improve Detail for JSDoc Completion Item
data.body:
For the JSDoc completion item, the details are not very useful:

![screen shot 2017-02-22 at 12 35 26 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/212305/23203330/ea2f118a-f896-11e6-84da-daca8d3d9abb.png)

We should either use the right-side text of the completion item for the `JSDoc Comment` text, or add some real information about the completion item to the details

data.title: Don't auto show JSDoc Suggestions when selecting first line of JSDoc comment
data.body:
For code:

```ts
/**
  *
  */
const x = 1
```

The jsdoc suggestions should not automatically be shown when placing the cursor on the first line after the `/**`. Currently it does:

![screen shot 2017-02-22 at 12 28 59 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/212305/23203138/038eaa38-f896-11e6-9881-d4e547de999f.png)

We should probably only automatically show the suggestion list when the cursor is inside a potential jsdoc comment, like so:

```ts
/**| */
```

In other cases, you would still be able to manually trigger the suggestions

data.title: TS & Extensions: warning about version mismatch between our TS version and extensions
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. use insiders on a fresh hello world extension
2. open it and see

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/23203164/abb9e8c6-f8e1-11e6-8486-7c6e32942b82.png)

We should either update your generator-code to use the same TS version or make sure we wait until TS 2.2 official is released and then announce stable. Otherwise every extension author will get this cryptic message.

data.title: [WelcomeUX] Request Feature: Open recent folder in a new window (landing page)
data.body:
I really liked the new landing/welcome page where I can open my recently used files or folders. I request a feature I believe would be very useful.

I am working on solutions (VS jargon) with multiple projects . Although I need to work on them simultaneously, I want to keep a single visual studio window for a single project. So on the welcomes page a keyboard+click (like Shitf+Click or Ctrl+Click) combination to open a recent folder in a new window would be great for me.

data.title: Cannot Find Module when extension is installed from Extension Marketplace
data.body:
Our extension is acting different from the visual studio code extension Marketplace installation than from the development environment.

- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.3

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Download extension [https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=postal-team.postal](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=postal-team.postal) it doesn't work.
2. Running git version [https://github.com/slichlyter12/Postal/tree/master/postal](https://github.com/slichlyter12/Postal/tree/master/postal) it does work. 

Running the installed version developer tools show: 

```
[Extension Host] Here is the error stack:  Error: Cannot find module 'find'
    at Function.Module._resolveFilename (module.js:455:15)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:403:25)
    at Function.V.o._load (/Applications/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/node/extensionHostProcess.js:14:30928)
    at Module.require (module.js:483:17)
    at require (internal/module.js:20:19)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/Users/user_name/.vscode/extensions/postal-team.postal-0.1.1/out/src/controller.js:7:14)
    at Module._compile (module.js:556:32)
    at Object.Module._extensions..js (module.js:565:10)
    at Module.load (module.js:473:32)
    at tryModuleLoad (module.js:432:12)
```

The issue is happening when we try to use the 'find' module: 

``` 
var finder = require('find');
```

Our package.json dependencies:

```
    "dependencies": {
        "app": "^0.1.0",
        "find": "0.2.7",
        "browser-window": "^0.4.0",
        "child_process": "^1.0.2",
        "electron": "^1.4.14",
        "file-system": "^2.2.1",
        "open": "0.0.5",
        "vis": "^4.17.0"
    },
```

We are thinking it has something to do with the prepublish and compiling. Our prepublishing and compiling script is as follows:

```
    "scripts": {
        "vscode:prepublish": "tsc -p ./;",
        "compile": "tsc -watch -p ./",
        "postinstall": "node ./node_modules/vscode/bin/install;"
    },
```

data.title: Typing `/**` should not automatically create a block comment in which each line is prefixed with `*`
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.9.1 (f9d0c687ff2ea7aabd85fb9a43129117c0ecf519, 2017-02-08T23:31:51.320Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.4.0

---

Currently, typing `/**` in a JavaScript or TypeScript file results in the insertion of an auto-closed block comment that looks like this:

```js
/** <cursor> */
```

When you press <kbd>enter</kbd>, you end up with a comment body in which each line is automatically prefixed by `*`:

```js
/**
 * <cursor>
 */
```

The editor is trying to be helpful, but there's no actual reason (other than personal aesthetic preference) to prefix each line of a multi-line JavaScript or TypeScript comment with a `*`. I'm not aware of any documentation tool that actually requires prefixed lines (this includes JSDoc).

I prefer my multi-line comment blocks not to have prefixed lines, but VSCode makes this a lot harder than it needs to be. At a minimum, it should be possible to disable comment autocompletion. Please consider removing this feature or making it configurable. Thanks!

data.title: Newline in Files search Regex not working
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: Mac OS 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Go to the Search sidebar
2. Turn on Regex
3. Search for something like "module\.exports\.(.*);" (without the quotes) - that works OK
4. Change that to "module\.exports\.(.*);\n" - still works OK
5. Change that to "module\.exports\.(.*);\nfunction" - does only find in the open files.
6. Note that in the editor search/replace (CMD-F), it works perfect (both search and replace too)

To make things even worse, when the search sidebar finds something using a regex with newline, if you try to use Replace, the sidebar UI gets completely screwed.

data.title: Feature Request: initialize emmet config
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.0-insider (Japanese)
- OS Version: Windows 10 ver:1607 (Japanese)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. install all default ( use: VSCodeSetup-1.9.0-insider.exe )
2. `C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Insiders\resources\app\node_modules\emmet\lib\snippets.json` is default
```json
{
	"variables": {
		"lang": "en",
	...
```
3. type emmet
```html
![tab]
```
4. change
```html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
...
```

## request

I hope same local setting (vscode lang: Japanese )

- `"lang": "en"` -> `"lang": "ja"`

```html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="ja">
...
```
